subject: Re: [junit] JUnit tests and common resources
msgSnippet: ... No, it ought not look like like that. It ought look like: TestCase() (constructor) TestCase() (constructor) TestCase() (constructor) setUp() test1()
messageBody:
On Thu, 17 Jun 2004, youlian wrote:

> I have read the JUnit Cookbook and undesrstand the reason - JUnit
> via reflection generates dynamically child classes. For each test
> method setUp and tearDown is invoked. The log would look something
> like this:
>
> setUp()
> setUp()
> setUp()
> ...
> test1()
> test2()
> testx()
> ...
> tearDown()
> tearDown()
> tearDown()

No, it ought not look like like that. It ought look like:

TestCase() (constructor)
TestCase() (constructor)
TestCase() (constructor)

setUp()
test1()
tearDown()

setup()
test2()
tearDown()

...

Perhaps you're allocating something in a constuctor or an initializer?

cjs
--
Curt Sampson <cjs@...> +81 90 7737 2974 http://www.NetBSD.org
Don't you know, in this new Dark Age, we're all light. --XTC
